title: file/directory permission on filesystem and "rename / delete"
body:
hi
firstly - excuse my bad english

owncloud 5.0.5

i have these permissions on filesystem:

chmod --recursive 755 /var/www/data/user

chmod 755 /var/www/data/user/cache
chmod 555 /var/www/data/user/files

chmod 755 /var/www/data/user/files/clientsync
chmod 555 /var/www/data/user/files/structure

example 1:

because "clientsync" parent directory ("files") has permission 555, it ("clientsync") can not be physically deleted from filesystem. but because "clientsync" own permission is 755, on the web interface it's still showing option for "rename / delete". this is no ok, because when user push the "delete cross" it disappears from web interface (of course on filesystem it still remains).

example 2

"structure" directory is not showing option for "rename / delete" because it's own permission is 555. this is ok.

is it posible to disable option for "rename / delete" of files / directory that can not be physically renamed / deleted, because it does not allow his parent directory?

thank you - i hope that you understand me

dusan ivanco
